intro: Celtis audibertiana var. ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf hackberry, is a deciduous tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Elm family (Ulmaceae) and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves that are often slightly lobed. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by spherical, smooth fruits that are typically eaten by birds and small mammals. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and is often found in woodland areas or along riverbanks.
